meanings.definition: A source or origin of a stream or river.
meanings.sent1: The mountain was the founts of the river that flowed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The spring served as the founts of the small stream in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The founts of the river seemed to play hide and seek with the explorers.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was a founts of inspiration for all her friends.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map marked the founts of the mighty river with a golden star.

meanings.definition: A source of a desirable quality or commodity.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the magical tree was the founts of endless happiness.
meanings.sent2: The local bakery was known as the founts of delicious pastries.
meanings.sent3: The founts of chocolate in the factory made everyone's day sweeter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a founts of joy that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The library was a founts of knowledge for the curious minds in town.

meanings.definition: A reservoir or supply of something.
meanings.sent1: The pantry was a founts of snacks for the hungry children.
meanings.sent2: The garden served as a founts of fresh vegetables for the family.
meanings.sent3: The founts of books in the library tempted her to stay all day.
meanings.sent4: His backpack was a founts of surprises during the school trip.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was a founts of excitement for the young pirates.
